channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Dead dolphins wash up on coast of Mauritius after Japanese ship spilled thousands of gallons of oil
item.description: The Japanese bulk carrier MV Wakashio ran aground on a coral reef near the eastern coast of Mauritius on July 25, leading to the deaths of many Electra dolphins.

item.title: Donald Trump turns his hotel into Republican Party central
item.description: President Trump's Washington D.C. hotel was party central Wednesday night for MAGA supporters, offering them a 'convention celebration' with the first family.

item.title: Meghan Markle praises 'feminist' Prince Harry to Gloria Steinem
item.description: Meghan, 39, interviewed activist Gloria, 86, for a Q&A shared on female empowerment platform Makers Women.

item.title: Sarah Harding 'made emotional calls to Girls Aloud stars
item.description: According to reports , the singer, 38, spoke to Cheryl, Nadine Coyle, Kimberley Walsh and Nicola Roberts before revealing to the world she has 'advanced' breast cancer.

item.title: Eat Out To Help Out diners battle to book for final days of 50% off
item.description: The success of Eat Out to Help Out in encouraging diners to leave their homes this month from Mondays to Wednesdays has led UK business leaders to call for the scheme to be extended into September.

item.title: Can you spot which meal is healthier? Dietitian shares two versions of a simple lunch
item.description: When you're making a salad at home for lunch, it can be easy to throw in all manner of ingredients thinking what you're adding is healthy. Brisbane dietitian Paula Norris showed off two lunches.

item.title: Now Royal Ascot considers axing traditional Rule Britannia and Land of Hope And Glory singalong
item.description: Organisers have confirmed they will potentially scrap the songs from the five-day Berkshire festival's world-famous bandstand celebrations in 2021.

item.title: This is Rusten Sheskey, the police officer involved in the shooting of Jacob Blake
item.description: The identification of the officer comes as Blake's tearful mother made a heartbreaking plea to 'examine your hearts' in the wake of protesting and rioting in Kenosha over the shooting.

item.title: Extinction Rebellion drops extreme claims from climate change film narrated by Keira Knightley
item.description: London-based producer Serena Schellenberg admitted there was insufficient evidence to support apocalyptic claims 'human extinction is a real possibility'.

item.title: PSG boss Thomas Tuchel 'made last-ditch effort to convince Thiago Silva to stay'
item.description: The Brazilian will undergo a medical with the Stamford Bridge outfit on Thursday after stating he had played his last game for the French side in their Champions League final defeat against Bayern.

item.title: Government issues new 5G masts guide in bid to squash 'quack theories' that they spread coronavirus
item.description: Digital infrastructure minister Matt Warman and local government minister Simon Clarke have written to councils promoting a new guide on 5G masts to dispel 'quack' theories about the network.
item.media:description: A telecoms mast in Dagenham was damaged in a fire (Stefan Rousseau/PA)

item.title: NBA postpones playoff games after the Milwaukee Bucks boycott in response to the Jacob Blake
item.description: The NBA has postponed the remainder of Wednesday's playoff games after the Milwaukee Bucks boycotted their matchup with the Orlando Magic in response to the Jacob Blake shooting.

item.title: Button up for the Bank Holiday! Temperature will plummet this weekend after Storm Francis
item.description: The clear-up has begun after the storm, which saw gusts hit The Needles near the Isle of Wight on Tuesday. This is just short of the August record which was 87mph in 1996. Pictured: Sussex.

item.title: Britons who are ordered to self-isolate will be given £13-a-day to ensure they stay at home
item.description: The money will be paid to those in areas with high rates of infection, such as parts of the North West or Midlands, who receive Universal Credit or Working Tax Credit.

item.title: Home cook reveals her simple tip for stopping herbs and spices from 'clumping up' in the jar
item.description: A home cook has shared her simple tip to stop herbs and spices from 'clumping up' at the bottom of the jar, and all you need is a grain of dry rice.

item.title: Conservationist is mauled to death by 400lb white lions he kept at his South African safari lodge
item.description: West Mathewson, 68, was attacked by two mature lionesses after he unlocked their gate to take them for a morning walk on Wednesday at his safari lodge in Hoedspruit.

item.title: Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie lookalike spark romance rumours
item.description: The actor, 56, and multi-lingual German model Nicole Poturalski stepped out of a private jet as they flew from LAX to Charles de Gaulle before travelling to the smaller airport.

item.title: Save the Last Night of the Proms
item.description: More than 100,000 people have signed the MailOnline petition urging the BBC to reverse its censorship of the two iconic songs.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews last night's TV: Scientist whose full-time job is trying to cheat death
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Robotics scientist Peter Scott-Morgan might be the most cheerful man in the world. 'Taking on the world is a hobby,' he says with a broad grin.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... ghost town Britain
item.description: 'Your father misses commuting since his bank told him to work from home'

item.title: Millenial rages at the selfish young lockdown breakers putting lives at risk with illegal parties
item.description: Millenial Flora Gill, the daughter of former Home Secretary Amber Rudd, reveals she was invited to a rave by an acquaintance she bumped into at the pub last week.

item.title: CRAIG BROWN: Mine's a pint... and a sniff of British boozer
item.description: CRAIG BROWN: A company has brought out a range of candles designed to evoke the smells of places and events - the cinema, the festival, the local - cancelled this summer.

item.title: ANDREW PIERCE: Quite what Brussels will make of the new Brexit trade envoy remains to be seen
item.description: ANDREW PIERCE: Tony Abbott's knack of generating headlines is legendary; from consuming a raw onion whole, skin and all, to showing his appreciation to agricultural workers.

item.title: Israel launches air strikes against Hezbollah in Lebanon
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu blamed the shooting on Shiite militant group Hezbollah with which Israel fought a devastating month-long war in 2006.

item.title: Surfer who was almost killed until her partner rained punches reveals why the predator attacked her
item.description: Chantelle Doyle, 35, was surfing with the love of her life Mark Rapley at Shelly Beach in Port Macquarie, on the New South Wales mid-north coast, when she was attacked at about 9.30am on August 15.

item.title: Changing Rooms 'is poised for return after 16 years with Carol Smillie and Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen'
item.description: The classic home makeover show aired on the BBC1 between 1996 and 2004, and has been credited with whetting the viewing public's appetite for property-themed programming.

item.title: Everest climbs success rate doubles in 30 years, with 1% deaths
item.description: Reaching 29,030 feet above sea level, the summit of Everest in the Himalayas attracts around 500 climbers wanting to scale the world's tallest peak each spring.

item.title: Savvy home decorator transforms an old chest of drawers into a modern piece of furniture
item.description: An Australian woman with a knack for DIY projects has shared how she transformed an old chest of drawers into a stylish, modern piece of furniture.

item.title: Women wait SIX TIMES longer than men to be diagnosed with heart failure, experts warn
item.description: Researchers found women wait 20 weeks on average after visiting a GP for the condition to be identified, compared to three and a half for men.

item.title: Bezos becomes first person to be worth $200 BILLION as Amazon stock soars during covid lockdown
item.description: Jeff Bezos has become the first person to be worth more than $200 billion, breaking the barrier on Wednesday following yet another rise in Amazon's share price - which has risen 80pc since January.

item.title: Pension funds will be ordered to warn of the risks climate change could have on members' investments
item.description: Work and Pensions Secretary Therese Coffey announced plans yesterday for the 100 largest pension schemes to be required to publish climate risk disclosures by the end of 2022.

item.title: 'The BBC is like W1A': Former news boss compares top of the corporation to the comedy spoof
item.description: Roger Mosey said the mockumentary, which sends up the corporation's politically correct bureaucracy, reflects 'a lot of truth'.

item.title: Ian Wright defends Alex Scott, Micah Richards and other black pundits targeted by racists
item.description: It was revealed on Wednesday that Le Tissier, Thompson and Nicholas, who have been longstanding pundits on the hugely popular programme hosted by Jeff Stelling, have been axed.

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: The unsackable class who truly govern us...
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER: The wicked old Soviet Union had a privileged administrative class. By Soviet standards they were well paid, and the lucky ones got dachas - cushy second homes.

item.title: Fresh BBC race row as Jamaica's foreign minister complains over Famalam sketch
item.description: Kamina Johnson-Smith branded the BBC Three show (pictured), which created a Jamaican version of Channel 4 show Countdown, 'outrageous and offensive'.

item.title: Detectives launch murder investigation after 22-year-old man is shot dead in the street
item.description: The alleged shooting happened on the junction of Wheeler Street and Lozells Road just after 12.30pm today.

item.title: Internet wags spot pointed choices on bookshelf behind Boris Johnson during speech to pupils
item.description: Did a librarian take revenge on Boris Johnson today by displaying books with unflattering titles behind the PM during his livestream speech at a Leicestershire school?

item.title: Man 'who knocked commuter unconscious in London station mask row' is 35-year-old father of one
item.description: Adam Seymour, 35, allegedly punched John Adam, leaving his victim with blood pouring out of his head at Clapham Junction Railway station.

item.title: General says mothballing British Army's tanks is 'very dangerous' in face of threat from Russia
item.description: General Lord Dannatt described the notion of storing the army's entire force of hundreds of tanks and armoured vehicles until there was a crisis as 'misguided'.

item.title: Tory MPs urge Boris Johnson not to keep following Scotland's lead
item.description: Several senior figures spoke out on Wednesday to urge the Prime Minister to 'get a grip' on the Government, following another embarrassing policy switch on masks in secondary schools.

item.title: ALISON BOSHOFF: Plus-size model and 'fat activist' Honey Ross publicly shamed her famous parents
item.description: Her 30,000 followers on Instagram already know that Honey Ross, the 23-year-old daughter of broadcaster Jonathan and screenwriter Jane Goldman, is 'in love' with herself and her body.

item.title: More than 15million patients are waiting for treatment on NHS's 'hidden' waiting list
item.description: Freedom of Information requests to NHS trusts in England have put the total number of people yet to have their first hospital appointment after a GP referral at 15.3million.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Carla Bruni reveals she slept with Nicolas Sarkozy on their second date
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: 'It was love at first sight,' Carla Bruni says. 'I can't believe I got that at 40 years old - it was crazy. I would never have thought that could happen at that age.'

item.title: Bette Midler backtracks after being branded a 'racist' for mocking Melania Trump's accent
item.description: On Wednesday, after widespread backlash, the Beaches actress walked back her remarks, while stopping short of issuing an apology to the First Lady herself.

item.title: Backlash as Australia's 'gaffe-prone' ex-Prime Minister Tony Abbott appointed to Brexit trade role
item.description: Tony Abbott, 62, is said to be joining the Board of Trade in an advisory role as Britain's post-Brexit trade envoy, but his appointment was condemned by Labour's Emily Thornberry.

item.title: Government advice on PPE was 'confusing' and 'not visible' during the peak of UK's crisis
item.description: An investigation by the Healthcare Safety Investigation Branch revealed a shielding patient died of Covid-19 after a visit from carers who had been told they didn't need to wear PPE.

item.title: Only 10% of people plan to return to living exactly as they did before Covid-19
item.description: University College London (UCL) has quizzed 70,000 people in the UK. Just half of people said they were more likely on balance to return to how things were before lockdown.

item.title: Germany scraps plans for EU Brexit talks because 'there's been no progress' in discussions
item.description: EU officials believe Britain is prepared to risk a no-deal exit when the transition period comes to an end on December 31 and will try to pin the blame on Brussels. Pictured: Angela Merkel.

item.title: Sex and the City author Candace Bushell says she once went for a 'romantic' dinner with John Corbett
item.description: Candace, who the character of Carrie Bradshaw is based on Team Aidan' for 'a variety of reasons' - including that her mother hated him.

item.title: John Lennon's killer Mark Chapman denied parole for 11th time
item.description: Now 65, Chapman has been in prison since 1980 for murdering Lennon outside The Dakota on Manhattan's Upper West Side. He remains in custody in the Wende Correctional Facility.

item.title: Dame Vera Lynn's daughter hits out at decision to perform Rule Britannia without vocals
item.description: Virginia Lewis-Jones said it was 'wonderful' that a rendition of the track by the forces' sweetheart topped the charts after the race row about its meaning.

item.title: CBI boss Carolyn Fairbairn demands Boris Johnson leads UK firms back into the workplace
item.description: Writing in the Mail, Carolyn Fairbairn, the director-general of the CBI says getting UK staff back into offices and workplaces is as important as the return of pupils to school.

item.title: Normal People's Daisy Edgar-Jones says she was really proud to work on a show with 'equal nudity'
item.description: Star of BBC's Normal People Daisy Edgar-Jones, 22, told the Edinburgh TV Festival she was 'privileged' to have played the character of Marianne Sheridan in the BBC hit.

item.title: Chelsea hit by Covid-19 outbreak as MULTIPLE players test positive ahead of pre-season return
item.description: The west London club confirmed a number of players have tested positive for Covid-19 and are in quarantine to limit the threat of further spreading among Frank Lampard's squad.

item.title: UK car production slumps by a fifth in July
item.description: Just 85,696 new models left vehicle plants last month, which is 22,543 fewer than in July 2019, official figures have revealed today.

item.title: Major drop in house prices 'unlikely' as buyer demand jumps
item.description: With demand continuing to outstrip supply, house price growth looks set to remain at between 2 to 3 per cent by the end of the year, Zoopla's latest findings claim.

item.title: YouTube: AI moderators deleting twice as many videos as humans
item.description: Between April and June 2020, YouTube took down over twice as many videos as it did the three months prior. Using AI during the pandemic rather than human reviewers made the system precise.

item.title: Deformities of shark found in Sardinia sea from 'climate change'
item.description: A female catshark was caught off the coast of Sardinia that was without skin and teeth. Experts say the abnormalities were caused by chemically contaminated waters and climate change.
item.media:credit: Antonello Mulas of the University of Cagliari, Italy

item.title: Bread prices to rise after worst wheat harvest in 40 years
item.description: Extreme UK weather since last autumn could mean wheat yields fall by up to 40 per cent - pushing up the price of bread and other baked products.

item.title: Do you cheat when you eat?
item.description: Experts compared the diets of more than half a million Britons with the recommendations in Public Health England's Eatwell Guide.

item.title: Sarah Harding kept her biggest fight secret, writes BARBARA DAVIES
item.description: BARBARA DAVIES: The judges on TV reality show Popstars: The Rivals took a matter of seconds to decide that British singer Sarah Harding had star quality.

item.title: Who'll find love on our blind date? This week it's Louise, 35, and Simon, 33
item.description: Every week, FEMAIL sends two singletons on a socially distanced blind date and asks them to report back. This week Louise, 35, and Simon, 33, met for a socially distanced date...

item.title: Facebook says Apple iOS 14 privacy update limits ads targeting
item.description: Facebook is speaking out against Apple's upcoming iOS 14, saying the new privacy features will limit its ability to target iPhone owners with personalized ads and result in a loss of revenue for the firm.

item.title: As Catherine Zeta-Jones jumps on beauty bandwagon... Which star's make-up is worth the mark up?
item.description: Catherine Zeta-Jones has launched a £15 eyeliner and £22 mascara and the rest of her collection is coming soon. Victoria Beckham's range is pricey but the products deliver.

item.title: Engineer creates 'AI Jesus' by feeding a system the King James Bible that produces scripture
item.description: An engineered created 'AI Clone of Jesus' by feeding artificial intelligence the King James Bible. The system has produced 30,000 words, some resembling the bible and others are just glitches.

item.title: Afghan interpreter is reunited with his wife after Mail campaign
item.description: Toryali, who served with the UK Armed Forces, dreamt for four painful years of bringing his wife to join him here in Britain, away from the threat of the Taliban's gunmen.
item.media:credit: The Washington Post via Getty Im

item.title: Kremlin-linked businessman dubbed 'Putin's chef' vows to financially ruin poisoned Alexei Navalny
item.description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, whose company Konkord has laid on catering for the Kremlin, said that if Navalny recovers he'll go after him for £885,000 he owes in damages.

item.title: In this magical sequel, JAMES REBANKS mourns the end of his father's farming ways
item.description: JAMES REBANKS: We are building a herd on the little fell farm in the Lake District which once belonged to my grandfather.

item.title: Now that IS a bonk-buster!
item.description: MARK EDMONDS: Mary Ann Evans had an extraordinary interest in sex. Despite being born in the same year as Queen Victoria, she would stop at nothing to satisfy her desires.

item.title: Man, 17, is charged as two BLM protesters shot dead in Kenosha
item.description: Kyle Rittenhouse, of Antioch, Illinois, was arrested on Wednesday afternoon and charged with first degree intentional homicide.

item.title: Four American troops wounded after Russian forces RAMMED their vehicle in eastern Syria
item.description: The troops were wounded when their MRAP vehicle was rammed near Dayrick, northeast Syria, on Monday. The chairman of the joint chiefs will hold crisis talks with his Moscow equivalent.

item.title: Hurricane Laura will bring 'unsurvivable storm surge' and hit Texas and Louisiana as Category 4
item.description: Hurricane Laura rapidly gained strength Wednesday to become a catastrophic Category 4 hurricane that is expected to bring 'unsurvivable storm surge' to Louisiana and Texas.

item.title: SUSANNA REID: Curries and custard creams have left me with a dadbod!
item.description: Susanna Reid admits she's been 'torturing' herself by scrolling through photos of celebrities wearing bikinis. The British columnist questions if all women should adopt the 'dadbob' look.

item.title: Tony Hall almost quit as BBC boss after Government offloaded responsibility for free TV licences
item.description: In his final interview before he leaves next month, Lord Hall also admitted the BBC responded 'too slowly' in the equal pay row sparked by Carrie Gracie.

item.title: Should primary school children wear masks?
item.description: Michelle Ogundehin and Liz Cole debate if primary school children should wear masks, as teachers in England are given the go ahead to order secondary pupils to wear masks in communal areas.

item.title: London to New York 'air corridor' considered to save airlines
item.description: Proposals are at very early stages. But if they get the go-ahead, New York could become the UK's first 'regional travel corridor' destination (pictured, Heathrow Terminal 5).

item.title: Four-year-old boy sinks a hole in one on West Virginia golf course
item.description: Little Rocco Figaretti may be tender in his years, but his dad Mario believes he could have a golfing prodigy on his hands following a video he captured Oglebay Park golf course, West Virginia.

item.title: What to wear this weekend: FEMAIL picks out the best dip-dye items
item.description: Camilla Ridley-Day shares advice for embracing this season's dip-dye trend at any occasion. The British style expert picked out a selection of the best pieces available from High Street and online stores.

item.title: Michelin starred make-aways! It's the new way to enjoy gourmet food at home
item.description: Sudi Pigott gives her verdict on a selection of makeaways, as top chefs offer the possibility to enjoy their finest foods at home. The British writer was least impressed with Black Swan at Oldstead.

item.title: Woman gets £30 food shopping for just £3 with anti-waste app
item.description: Food shopping is an expensive part of every family's week, but Alice Griffiths, 25, from Southport, has supermarket bargain-hunting down to a fine art.

item.title: Reporting a violent partner is traumatic but when abuser is policeman, it's even harder
item.description: Jodie was attacked by her boyfriend PC Clarke Joslyn. And Nicola Richardson endured years of sexual violence at the hands of her abuser and husband, former officer Wayne Scott (pictured).

item.title: 50p coin paying tribute to Girl Guides sells on eBay for £400 because it has 'printing error'
item.description: The coin was released in 2010 to celebrate 100 years of the UK's Girl Guides and features the famous three-leaf 'trefoil' logo - a symbol of the guides' three-fold promise.

item.title: Kenosha protests: Looter knocks out man trying to protect store
item.description: Businesses in Kenosha have been left decimated and destroyed following three consecutive nights of rioting and looting spurred by the Sunday police shooting of unarmed black man, Jacob Blake.

item.title: DOMINIC SANDBROOK: In Washington DC, a diner is tormented by Black Lives Matter mob
item.description: DOMINIC SANDBROOK: The footage could hardly be more chilling. A woman sits at a table, recoiling in fear. She is surrounded by a mob of masked men and women, their clenched fists raised menacingly.

item.title: Wales driver admits killing 24-year-old girlfriend by careless driving
item.description: Sion Francis Davies (pictured outside Caernarfon court) pleaded guilty to causing the death of his girlfriend Fflur Green at Gellilydan near Blaenau Ffestiniog, Wales.

item.title: NYPD search for man who savagely attacked woman in Brooklyn
item.description: The NYPD is looking for a man seen on surveillance video savagely punching a 46-year-old woman laying dazed on the sidewalk in Williamsburg after being ambushed early Tuesday morning.

item.title: How the super rich give birth, clue: They hire a 'mummy concierge' to do it all for them
item.description: Tiffany Norris, 38, Judy Goldberg, 36, and Sarah Dixon, 38, who offer elite services to wealthy mothers in the UK, revealed the inspiration behind their mummy concierge services.

item.title: After years of buttoned-up styles, turn your back for this season's subtle return to sexy
item.description: Jess Wood shares her advice for embracing this season's trend for outfits that expose your back. British style expert says your choice of underwear is crucial and suggests self-adhesive bras.

item.title: ALEX BRUMMER: Chancellor to revisit furlough plan?
item.description: The UK's performance during lockdown has been so much worse than that of our competitors that it verges on embarrassment, at minus-20.4 per cent against an average of minus-9.8 per cent.

item.title: TIM ALDERSLAKE: Coronavirus testing needed at UK airports
item.description: To save Britain's aviation industry and wider economy from the fallout of Covid-19 and its aftershocks, it is imperative the PM follows the logic understood by our European neighbours.

item.title: Peter: The Human Cyborg: Scientist diagnosed with motor neurone disease opens up about journey
item.description: Peter Scott-Morgan, 62, from Devon, who has motor neurone disease, appears in Channel 4's documentary Peter: The Human Cyborg tonight, as he uses technology to transform his life.

item.title: Everyday Ageism: FEMAIL columnist CHRISTA D'SOUZA on going prematurely grey
item.description: CHRISTA D'SOUZA made the decision to go prematurely grey 18 months ago and felt like a trendsetter, until a holiday on the Greek island of Mykonos last week.

item.title: EU trade commissioner resigns for breaking coronavirus rules
item.description: EU trade commissioner Phil Hogan had been under intense pressure after attending an Irish parliamentary golf society dinner in the west of Ireland last Wednesday with 80 other people.
item.media:description: EU trade commissioner Phil Hogan is to resign (Niall Carson/PA)

item.title: I knew my marriage was doomed as I walked down the aisle
item.description: Helly Acton recalls her decision to end her marriage, less than six months after they got married in London. She says the experience cured her desire to achieve a list of targets by the age of 30.

item.title: McDonald's probes sacked CEO's improper conduct 'cover-up'
item.description: 53-year-old British executive Steve Easterbrook was dismissed last November after his relationship with a McDonald's employee came to light.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Chicken factory closes as 75 workers infected
item.description: Banham Poultry in the village of Attleborough has voluntarily agreed to close its cutting room tomorrow following an outbreak of the disease.

item.title: Christopher Nolan's blockbuster Tenet opens to UK audiences
item.description: Eager film fans across Britain were tonight greeted by staff wearing face coverings and a one-way system to the tills as they arrived to experience post-lockdown cinema.

item.title: Boris Johnsons bizarre back-to-school speech baffles pupils
item.description: The Prime Minister made the remarks as he addressed a roomful of pupils at a Leicestershire school as he pushed his plan to have all children back for the autumn term next week.

item.title: Man, 22, arrested over murder by a gang of thugs with swords
item.description: A 22-year-old man has been the fourth arrested over the murder of Salem Koudou, 20, who was knifed to death following a confrontation after a car overturned in Brixton on August 20.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 11 Plymouth teenagers infected on Greek holiday
item.description: Plymouth City Council are dealing with a Covid-19 outbreak that involves up to 30 young people, after a group returned from Zante in Greece last week. Eleven members of the group have tested positive.

item.title: NASA astronaut to be first black woman to go on ISS mission
item.description: Jeanette Epps will be joining astronauts Sunita Williams and Josh Cassada for the six-month expedition that has an expected launch date of 2021

item.title: Polish zoo to give marijuana to elephants to reduce stress levels
item.description: Warsaw Zoo will start giving its three African elephants liquid doses of cannabinoid, also known as CBD oil, through their trunks. The new project will test if it reduces the elephants's stress levels.

item.title: Ex-Unite union baron Tony Woodley turns down Corbyn peerage
item.description: Tony Woodley, 72, who was joint general secretary of trade union Unite, was offered the position by Mr Corbyn when he was leader of the Labour party.

item.title: Bulldogs and pugs popular as they're seen as easy to look after
item.description: Owners like flat-faced dogs because they need little exercise or space, making them suitable for busy lifestyles and city living, a study by the Royal Veterinary College in London found

item.title: Driver denies murder after woman he ran over dies months later
item.description: Robert Barrow, 54, of Chigwell, Essex, was charged with the murder of Tahereh Pirali-Dashti, 40, and attacking 56-year-old Asghar Moradmand.

item.title: Next season's LaLiga will be free for UK viewers until OCTOBER
item.description: Sky subscribers will be able to catch the likes of Real Madrid, Barcelona and Atletico Madrid in action when the division starts on September 12, with the top flight on offer for free until October 1.

item.title: Pharmacist 'threatened woman who wouldn't date son, 7'
item.description: Yaw Akuoko-Frempong, from Devon, allegedly told the woman that men would come in a 'big black van' to blindfold her and 'take her away' if she continued to refuse to date his son.

item.title: Coast Guard Watch shoots 8-FOOT SHARK near swimmers
item.description: The Long-Fin Mako or Pelagic Thresher shark was spotted making a beeline for US Coast Guard Cutter Kimball shipmates as they were swimming in the sea Wednesday.

item.title: Sky Sports sack Matt Le Tissier, Charlie Nicholas and Phil Thompson
item.description: Matt Le Tissier has been sacked by Sky Sports from his position as a Soccer Saturday pundit, along with both Phil Thompson and Charlie Nicholas. Sweeping changes are now expected.

item.title: Taunton son whose father gave him Macallan whisky every year puts collection up for sale for £40,000
item.description: Matthew Robson, 28, was born in 1992 and Pete (pictured together), 64, bought a bottle of whisky to celebrate his birth. Pete then decided to buy his son a bottle of single malt Scotch every year.

item.title: Harry Maguire's assault conviction will 'hang over his head' for up to three years
item.description: The Manchester United captain is appealing against his conviction for assault and attempted bribery of a police officer, the Premier League club said today.

item.title: Staycationers face Bank Holiday travel chaos
item.description: The RAC is predicting the busiest weekend of traffic of the year with 18million journeys expected to take place over the Bank Holiday weekend.

item.title: Eamonn Holmes and Nigel Farage clash with 'extremist' Black Lives Matter activist
item.description: Eamonn Holmes, Nigel Farage and Femi Oluwole appeared on This Morning to discuss whether patriotic British songs like Rule Britannia should be sung at the Proms.

item.title: He's alive', 'Kill him': Footage shows Mexican soldier ordering the shooting of a cartel member
item.description: An investigation has been launched into a shootout between troops and a cartel murder squad, after bodycam footage showed a soldier killing a surviving gang member in Nuevo Laredo, Mexico.

item.title: The Instagram hunk and celebrity personal trainer whipping Boris into shape
item.description: The Prime Minster was snapped running near Westminster in central London today with trainer to the stars Harry Jameson as he continues his battle to lose weight.

item.title: Over 200,000 learners backed-up in online queues to book driving tests
item.description: The DVSA site now confirms that all the available driving test slots have been issued and learners' next opportunity to queue en masse for a test was Tuesday 1 September.

item.title: Ice Age average global temperature '11°F colder than today'
item.description: Researchers from the US combined data from tiny marine fossils with climate models to forecast the weather during the so-called Last Glacial Maximum (LGM).

item.title: Melania Trump 'complained Ivanka didn't show her respect'
item.description: Melania Trump's former close friend and staffer Stephanie Winston Wolkoff is set to release her book Melania and Me next week. It includes claims the First Lady trashed Trump's children.

item.title: Boy, 5, saves mother's life dialling number on toy ambulance
item.description: Josh Chapman dialled 112 after his mother Caroline collapsed in their home in Telford, Shropshire. Despite having never used a phone before, Josh managed to get through to a 999 police operator.

item.title: Second head rolls over exam fiasco as Boris Johnson fires top education civil servant
item.description: Jonathan Slater's removal was announced today, 24 hours after Ofqual chief executive Sally Collier resigned in the wake of the grading U-turn. He will officially leave on September 1.

item.title: Sky Mobile launches 'text-to-ditch' relationship-ending service
item.description: For those who are keen to end it without an awkward face-to-face discussion, there's a new 'Text-to-ditch' service enabling unhappy daters to request a personalised message to send to their soon-to-be ex

item.title: ISIS 'Beatles' WILL be tried in US over beheading of captives in Syria
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Alexanda Kotey, 36, and El-Shafee El-Sheikh, 32, are accused of being members of the terror cell which was behind the beheading of two British aid workers and two US journalists in Syria.

item.title: Biblical village of Bethsaida where Jesus walked on water is finally identified by archaeologists
item.description: Professor Rami Arav of the University of Nebraska believes that Et-Tell, an archaeological dig site in the Golan Heights, is the same place as the biblical village.

item.title: Experts fear osteoporosis drugs may make bones WEAKER
item.description: Researchers at Imperial College London found people who had never had a broken bone had more flexible collagen in their hip bones. Osteoporosis drugs may reduce this flexibility.

item.title: Iran to allow UN nuclear inspectors to access two suspect sites
item.description: The International Atomic Energy Agency said Tehran was 'voluntarily providing the IAEA with access to two locations and facilitating the IAEA verification activities to resolve the issues.'

item.title: UK announces Covid-19 deaths for Wednesday
item.description: NHS England confirmed that nine more people have died in its hospitals since Saturday, August 22, and the two deaths in Scotland are the country's first since July 16.

item.title: Gatwick Airport is planning to axe up to 600 jobs in 'significant restructure'
item.description: Up to 600 jobs are set to be cut at Gatwick Airport, around a quarter of its workforce, as it struggles to cope with the effects of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Is this the world's youngest talking baby?
item.description: Caroline, 37, and Nick, 36, from Willaston, Cheshire, couldn't believe their ears when their eight-week-old son Charlie-John Taylor-Mullington replied to his father with the word 'hello'.

item.title: Bitter £3m legal battle between Elton John and ex-wife Renate Blauel grows MORE poisonous
item.description: Renate Blauel has hit back at ex-husband Sir Elton John, who accused her of chasing his money after she lodged a £3 million damages claim against the rocker.

item.title: Russian schoolgirl, 13, who claimed boy, 10, fathered her child leaves hospital with baby
item.description: Darya Sudnishnikova, 13, who claimed that her boyfriend, 10, had impregnated her, has now left a clinic in Krasnoyarsk, Siberia, with baby Emelia, who weighed in at 8lbs and measured 21 inches.

item.title: Army of tiny injectable marching robots set to wage war on disease
item.description: The new real-world micro-bots could monitor nerve impulses in the heart or brain, according to scientists from Cornell University who created the machines.

item.title: 'Union dividend' deals 'hammer blow' to Nicola Sturgeon's independence hopes
item.description: Total public sector expenditure for the benefit of Scotland, including both UK and Scottish government spending, has increased by just over three per cent to £81 billion.

item.title: Russia releases never-before-seen footage of the Tsar Bomba test
item.description: Russia's nuclear energy agency has released never-before-seen footage of the test of the Tsar Bomba nuclear bomb in 1961, which produced the largest man-man explosion in history.

item.title: Man United could be doing Harry Maguire a FAVOUR by stripping him of captaincy, says Danny Mills
item.description: Maguire has already been withdrawn from Gareth Southgate's England squad after his guilty verdict in Greece. He was found guilty of aggrivated assault, resisting arrest and bribery

item.title: Chemical found in insect repellents 'can kill the coronavirus'
item.description: The Defence Science and Technology Laboratory (DSTL) conducted the research on the naturally occurring chemical Citriodiol, found in Mosi Guard.

item.title: Brazilian city Manaus where dead bodies were piled up in refrigerated trucks may have herd immunity
item.description: Brazil's worst-hit city made world headlines four months ago when drone images captured bulldozers digging mass graves for Covid-19 victims. But it may have led to herd immunity.

item.title: Oliver and Olivia remain most popular baby names in England and Wales
item.description: Oliver is the most popular name for boys in England and Wales for the seventh year in a row, while Olivia topped the girls' list for the fourth year in succession, according to the Office for National Statistics (ONS).

item.title: Immune response could explain why coronavirus hits men harder
item.description: A new study from Yale University found men tended to have high levels of pro-inflammatory proteins called cytokines early in the infection, which can lead to deadly cytokine storms.

item.title: Nora Quoirin may have been 'alive and moving around' during first days of search, inquest hears
item.description: The body of 15-year-old Nora, who had learning difficulties, was discovered unclothed on August 13 last year after a massive hunt through the rainforest near Seremban.

item.title: JANET STREET-PORTER: Harry Maguire and OUR booze problem
item.description: Whatever the truth about the brawl that occurred, there's no disputing the huge amount of alcohol Maguire and his pals had consumed over a drinking session, writes JANET STREET-PORTER.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle officially change the title of Sussex Royal to MWX Foundation
item.description: Prince Harry, 35, and Meghan Markle, 39, have officially changed the name of their charity from Sussex Royal Foundation to the MWX Foundation after stepping back from working for The Firm.

item.title: All-electric 'flying taxi': from London to Brighton in 30 minutes
item.description: Bristol-based designers Vertical Aerospace said that the craft is set to be the first winged, electric vertical-take-off-and-landing craft to be certified.

item.title: Inside Harry's £29k-a-week Mykonos villa: Luxury home Man U star stayed at before Greek cop assault
item.description: The stunning waterfront property overlooks the golden coastline of popular Paradise and Paraga Beaches. The villa was home to Maguire who was holidaying with friends and family last week

item.title: Couple who bought 'Covid-proof' wedding insurance policy had to fight to get their money back
item.description: Lidia Schmitt and Adam Burton, from Portsmouth, bought a policy that included protection against their venue being forced to close. However when they tried to claim, they were greeted with silence.

item.title: Two more Team GB gymnasts call for athletes to speak out after she stood down amid bullying probe
item.description: Double-Olympian Hannah Whelan, 28, and Olympic athlete Jennifer Pinches, 26, used social media to call on gymnasts to come forward. Amanda Reddin has temporarily stepped down from gymnastics.
